intro: Agrestis hyemalis, commonly known as the winter agrestis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often releasing a mild scent when crushed. Agrestis hyemalis is noted for its early blooming habit, making it an important early nectar source for pollinators.
